subject: PHYSICS
summary: This lesson covers the different energy stores and how energy is transferred within systems, introducing important concepts in physics.
contentItems: The different types of energy store.
The different ways energy can be transferred.
learningObjectives: Identify and describe different types of energy stores.
Explain how energy is transferred between stores.
Differentiate between open and closed systems.
Define work done and apply the concept to real-world scenarios.

starter.activity: Quick quiz on energy types (students write answers on post-it notes and stick them on the board). Review answers as a class to reinforce concepts.

mainActivities.activity: Group activity to categorize different types of energy stores and discuss examples in real life. Provide a structured template for students to fill in.
Interactive demonstration of energy transfer using a simple system (e.g., pendulum or spring). Include a guided worksheet for students to complete during the demonstration.

plenary.activity: Class discussion to recap the key points and address any questions. Students summarize their learning on whiteboards and share with peers.

assessmentMethods: Observation of group discussions and activities.
Exit ticket where students write down one thing they learned and one question they still have.
Review of completed worksheets for understanding.

homework.task: Complete the worksheet on energy transfers and systems, including definitions and examples. Prepare a short presentation on one type of energy store and its applications in daily life.

teacherNotes: Ensure to check understanding during main activities and provide support to groups as needed. Circulate around the room to assist students and encourage participation.
